data.title: Good food, but a little pricey
data.text: These people are geniuses. On Sundays, they barbecue steaks in front of the entrance, It just hits you when you leave the movie theater, I recommend their steaks, salads, and onion loaf. I have never been disappointed.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: The staff is Awesome and the food is even better. If you want to relax have a cold beer  some great fish dip and wings this is the place for you. Patrick the manager is one of the best.

data.title: A rare gem in an outdated shopping plaza
data.text: JoJo's Raw Bar & Grill is located in an older shopping plaza in Wellington, Fl.  It is near the "Old Wellington Movie Theatre".  It is a very casual, friendly neighborhood bar & grill.  They have a fantastic amount of domestic, import and craft beers, as well as a full bar with house and premium drinks.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  The food is amazing!  Our favorite is the wings...which I order extra crispy...it takes a little longer to arrive, but worth the extra time.  There is happy hour from 3pm - 6pm and the menu offers something for everyone...from appetizers big enough to share, to juicy burgers and sandwiches to entrees.  Visit JoJos for your next date night, or for a family night out or for a time to get together with friends.

data.title: BEST CHICKEN WINGS EVER!
data.text: We always order Chicken wings to go, They are Fantastic!! they also have a wonderful soup and fish deep!!!!

data.title: Always Good Food
data.text: Went once again to Jojo's last night when I didn't feel like cooking ! I Had the Cheeseburger with fries , my wife had Blacken Chicken Wrap with a Mac & cheese side ...went in late 9pm, and food came out after i finished my 1st beer !

data.title: Fun spot for good,burgersendless draft beer choices,oysters,etc
data.text: Wonderful spot for informal dining any night of the week with great service,great burgers,endless beer menu,freshly  shucked oysters,clams,chicken Phillys & great service...ask for Sims....he will make your night. This is the place for fun informal dining with surprisingly excellent quality.

data.title: dirty inside
data.text: Cold Beer for sure, nice TV's, but real dirty place. Seems like a Owner absentee biz, and manager not treating the place like his own and Burger was good- but, no Duffy's that is for sure

data.title: Happy to Have Found This Place
data.text:
Recently moved to the area and have been discovering new places to try for dinner.  I googled places in Wellington and came up with this raw bar / grill.  

Straight up, the place isn't fancy.  It's a typical bar but not typical food.  We were there on a Sunday night which happens to be grill night.  They have a large smoker / grill out front.  You can order a steak by the ounce and they grill it there for you.  Though we didn't get steaks, we ordered the smoked wings as an appetizer. They were great!!! Nice size chicken wings smoked but not too smokey.  

My cousin ordered the blackened shrimp.  She said they were cooked to perfection.  The other guest ordered the macaroni and cheese.  She said it was the best Mac n cheese she ever ate.  I personally ordered the Maryland style crab cakes.  Originally from Maryland and a self proclaimed pro of crab cakes - this was no where near Maryland crab cakes.  They were specks of jumbo lump crab meat, but the majority was filler.  

On a more positive note, the waiter was fabulous.  He knew the menu so well and stressed how everything was homemade including the salad dressings. He even told us that Wednesday's are bingo night and they have trivia night too

Overall, this place has very good food ...prices are good and service wS excellent

data.title: Good!
data.text: Very good! I havn't been there in a while but I would reccomend.I've been there a dozen times and no complaints

data.title: Glad I Dropped In
data.text: This is a neighborhood place that offers some nice surprises. My husband and I really enjoyed everything we ordered and had a great time listening to the band. Too often, we eat at restaurants that offer a bland experience, this was not bland. We will be back.

data.title: A real gem!
data.text: JoJo's was a great find...it was walking distance to our rented flat...always a plus. They have great happy hour prices for drinks, chicken wings and shrimp. Also a nice menu...fun place for the whole family!!

data.title: Great place to relax.
data.text: Exactly what I expected when I heard the name.  Very casual with great service, interesting menu choices, wide beer menu.  Located in a strip mall and not easy to find the first time  but we went back for a second meal!

data.title: Super bowl at Jojo's
data.text: Almost a tradition. I believe this is our fifth, possibly sixth year, we watched the super bowl game at Jojo's. Diesel, the chef, put out a spread to die for, Ribs, wings, fried mozzarella, salad, steak tied bits, shrimp....the works. TVs for viewing the game are everywhere, and, most importantly, a great crowd. The bartenders are the friendliest around and worked their butts off making sure everyone was happy. Great night. I know that One night doesn't a great place make, but with Jojo's no problem every night is great. One of Our favorite local places.

data.title: A bar/pub with better quality food and good prices.
data.text:
JoJo’s is located on Wellington Trace by the movie theater. It has plenty of outdoor seating and it’s pretty big inside, almost dispersive.
Food is pub fare but with an enhanced touch. This makes it to me maybe not a favorite (we don’t eat a lot of burgers or fried things) but one of the top options when I feel like having a cold one and eat something while watching a sport game. 
Food is very good for a bar. Also, they have a lot of seafood and fish. We had a large sampler plates and it was very nice, tasty and fresh. 
Their menu is so various for a bar, that I never had a burger here, I always try something different and again, often end up ordering fish or seafood. 
Service is always pretty good, I normally sit at the bar by the way, so unless you completely ignore me, it’s difficult for me to trash service when at the counter…

It’s not gourmet and it is not supposed, but it is a better take on pub fare with plenty of variation, an extensive menu and pretty good prices considering the Wellington location.

data.title: Great Happy Hour Place
data.text:
The place has an excellent happy hour with great shrimp, wings, and clam deals.

I have been here multiple times and it is a great place to happy hour and catch a movie next door at Movies of Wellington.

data.title: Great Local Bar
data.text: Great local place to grab a drink. Very close to home and cheap food/drinks. Inexpensive little casual restaurant

data.title: Faithful.
data.text: Regular spot for us when here for season. Service can be spotty but that does not keep us away. Our favorite is their peel n eat shrimp.

data.title: Night out
data.text: Good all round affordable food.  Seafood exceptional Recommend the blackened fish sandwich  .  Really one of the best I have had . With friends made a very special night.

data.title: local sports bar
data.text: food is average, service satisfactory,has billard tables, video games, does Trivia Nite which is always fun

data.title: Great meal
data.text: Every now and then we feel like having something different for dinner....Jojo's fits the bill ... Better known for their fresh fish and raw seafood specials, my hubby and I prefer trying their beef, pork or chicken specials. We were not disappointed. We had a crispy fried chicken breast smothered in a sausage gravy. Can I get an Amen...it was heaven.
